transcripts.text: Breaking news out of Sydney, Australia happened just a couple of hours ago.  Police followed a young mother with her two children out of a shopping centre.  They attempted to search her, ripping her bag for her and then arrest her for not wearing a mask.  But watch and share what happened next.

It's no criminal offence.  I walked out of the shop.  What did you ask?  Where's my mask?  I said I had an exemption, yeah?  You said, oh, okay, that's fine.  And I walked off and I said I know my rights.  As soon as I said I know my rights, what did you do?  You followed me out.  You followed me out of the shop.  This one's just standing here not saying anything.
No, you're not searching my bag.  refusal to comply is an offense.  you cannot search a person unless they're committing a crime.
wearing a mask is not committing a crime.  mandatory and compulsory is not law.

just remember That was for not wearing a mask and refusing to show her exemption as per the legislation.  The officer then goes off to call his sergeant and returns a couple of minutes later to the young mother to apologise.
What am I correct about?  not requiring to provide the ID or proof of exemption.  Thank you very much.
And you know what?  That is not an apology and your details is not frigging enough for doing what you just did in front of my kids.  Reaching into my bag and grabbing my wallet.

That's my name, as I said.  Hey, Michelle, that's my registered number on the card.  You're more than welcome and encouraged to go and make a complaint.  I should have known better.  That's on me.  Excuse me while I have a chat to massage.  And obviously you're no longer under arrest.
Notice the officer here wasn't even wearing a mask himself when he just arrested her for the same thing.

But credit where credit is due.  The officer put his hand up and apologized for getting it wrong, something we haven't seen a lot of lately.  But the fact that police are confused about how to enforce coronavirus rules, that he went to forcibly grab her bag and arrest her in front of her children is the fundamental problem we currently face.  I hope every cop watches this video and learns something from it.  People are beginning to resist.  They've had enough and the law is often on their side, not yours.  Do not use coronavirus as a power trip.  And if you see your partner getting it wrong, don't stand by.  Please stop them.  If you support this woman standing up for herself, make sure to like, comment and share to inspire others to do the same.  We need more of that.  Then head to Rebel News on YouTube, subscribe and hit that little notification button so you get the real news like this story as it happens without the mainstream media spit.
